intro: Priestleya elliptica, commonly known as the red spurge or red milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, colorful bracts. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and often have a reddish or purplish hue, while the flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Priestleya elliptica is known for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
